verses.roman:
tāṅhā haite punaḥ catur-vyūha-parakāśa
āvaraṇa-rūpe cāri-dike yāṅra vāsa

synonyms: tāṅhā haite—from that original catur-vyūha; punaḥ—again; catuḥ-vyūha-parakāśa—manifestation of quadruple expansions; āvaraṇa-rūpe—in the form of a covering; cāri-dike—in four directions; yāṅra—whose; vāsa—residence.
translation: "Thus the original quadruple forms again manifest Themselves in a second quadruple expansion. The residences of these second quadruple expansions cover the four directions.
